item.title: Transformers bullshit everywhere
item.description: No, there is no hyper-sheres in the Universe, sorry, Chuds.

item.title: LLM Bullshit-3
item.description: It is more or less obvious why AI and LLM bubble is so huge - imagine just charging money for every https request to a RESTful API, without, literally, being responsible about the quality of the responce (it is not out fault if a LLM returned bullshit to you, or, which is much worse – a highly sophisiticated, convincing subtle bullshit). Again, there is not enough good code to train a model on it.

item.title: Formulating the problem
item.description: These are just assorted notes for now, which shall become something ready to be formalized. Non-bullshit The objective is to train a NN which captures subtle recurrent patterns among many well-chosen (and well-defined) features. The proper set of features that, in turn, captures the most relevant aspects of reality is what determines the distinction between a modest success or a total failure of this ML approach. All the features should be actual “measurements” of something real, like “Open Interest” or the “Long/Short ratio” and other obvious measurements like “Volume”.
